text.tspan: Melancholy (4) - The tempo of battle is slowed down; Joe removes three
Exhaust (4) - Joe afflicts Drain on a target enemy unit for three turns.
Chaos (6) - Joe draws from unrefined, archaic magic, dealing 3INT + 20 damage
to all enemies (AoE). This cast stuns Joe for one turn following execution.
Blood Flare (10) - Consuming half of his current health, Joe inflicts pure
damage equal to 10INT to a target enemy.
Advice: Joe is extremely fragile, so consider placing him at or near the back
of the party. Although he is slow, Melancholy and Exhaust are brutal against
enemies who rely on stamina. Blood Flare's damage potential is excellent
throughout the game, especially as enemies' defenses increase.
DDOS (5) - Deals damage equal to 3INT to a target enemy. The enemy is
also stunned for one turn (three turns when using Iterate)
Debug (5) - Removes Bind, Mute, and Drain effects from the target ally
#YOLO (10) - Matthew don't care about stamina. Increases STR, INT, and
DEF by five, for five turns.
Iterate (3) - May be cast in conjunction with DDOS and Debug (see above)
Advice: Matthew is well-rounded, but particularly excels in status control.
DDOS with Iterate is one of the longest stuns in the game, and Debug with
Iterate is a rare stun-removing ability. If you want to play Matthew as a
frontline tank, #YOLO is solid -- just beware of its high stamina cost.
Agility (Passive) - Nicolas may use two abilities per turn.
Blitz (4) - Nicolas tramples the target enemy for STR + 30 damage.
Rally (4) - Nicolas inspires an allied unit, granting it four stamina.
Stretch (10) - Adept at endurance, Nicolas removes Stun, Drain, Bind, and
Mute from himself by stretching his muscles. This skill can be performed
when Nicolas is stunned or muted.
Advice: Nicolas makes up for his lackluster health and damage output by
being the fastest character in the game. Rally drastically improves the uptime
of powerful nukes that would otherwise be slow to recharge. Nicolas' biggest
weakness is against units with Drain abilities -- barring that, however, there
are few who match his ability to keep the party active and fighting.
Smash (7) - Ashwin bludgeons the enemy, dealing 5STR damage.
Logic Blast (7) - Ashwin logics the enemy, dealing 5INT damage.
Immaculate Form (10) - Ashwin achieves impressive physical and intellectual
gainz, gaining 50% (rounded down) extra STR and INT for four turns.
Advice: Ashwin excels at dealing high damage throughout the game. Smash
and Logic Blast are great against enemies with low INT and DEF, respectively,
and Immaculate Form scales with Ashwin's STR and INT. That being said,
Ashwin's health is average, his skills are expensive and he is rather slow; he
also has no disable control whatsoever. It might be useful to compliment him
with a stamina booster like Nicolas, or to switch him out after using
Immaculate Form in order to recover stamina (though this will be slower).
Bash (8) - Deals 2STR damage to a target enemy and stuns it for two turns.
Serve (4) - The tennis ball deals STR + INT damage and binds for two turns.
Well-Versed Argument (8) - Galen counters the target's poor logical
framework, dealing 2INT damage and muting them for three turns.
Preparation (5) - Galen studies the enemies' strategy, increasing DEF by
INT. Two stamina must be paid per turn to maintain the extra defense.
Advice: Galen is a multidimensional character, expert in status control as well
as tanking, and it's up to you to decide how to play him. Preparation scales
with Galen's phenomenal INT, but adds to the downtime of his disables due
to the upkeep cost. Drain is the bane of Galen, who relies on expensive skills
and has no status removal himself.
Swipe (4) - Deals 2STR + 10 damage to target enemy.
Greater Purge (6) - Removes Bind, Drain and Mute from target ally. James
may use this ability while muted himself, and he may use it on himself.
Lesser Purge (3) - Removes Drain from target ally.
Cleanse (4) - Heals the target ally for STR + 20 health.
Sacrifice (10) - Sacrifice James' life to revive a fallen ally. May be used
while muted. Ally is revived with full health and stamina, and previous level.
Advice: The definition of the tanky cleric. Lesser Purge and Cleanse are
fast and effective. James' only big weaknesses are extreme magic damage and
stuns. Aside from that, try not to use Sacrifice unless you need to...
